narrative.title: 5Th Indian Division - 1941Q1
narrative.situation: British Infantry Division deployed in North Africa during 1941Q1.
narrative.objectives: British-Indian infantry division deployed in East African Campaign. Specialized in infantry assault operations against prepared Italian defensive positions, operating in desert and mountain terrain with limited mechanization.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Mixed British and Indian units providing linguistic and cultural flexibility
Experience in desert operations from Sudan deployment (September 1940-January 1941)
Preparing for mountain warfare operations in Eritrea
Combined arms coordination with limited armoured support
Adapted to extreme desert conditions and logistics challenges
